page.title: 05CHANGES IN THE VILLAGE
page.content: As emploment in domestic service and the farming industry has shrunk, and lacking light industries, the population of the village has shrunk and now stands at about 850, about three quarters of what it was at the beginning of the century. Residents now in their sixties recall a time when there were 5 food shops including the present butcher shop and the remaining grocer cum newsagent. The hardware shop and Post Office still exist. Lost are the cobbler, tailor, blacksmith, hairdresser and the sweet shop. The grocer shop is thought to be used by most of the village population at least once a week and the Post Office by virtually 100%. Both retain the feel of being an important meeting place for an exchange of village news and views.
